datanode.api.v1.AccountsSubscribeRequest.description: Request to subscribe to a stream of (Accounts)[#vega.Account]

type.description: Account type to subscribe to, required field

balance.description: Balance of the asset, the balance is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places and importantly balances cannot be negative

id.description: Unique account identifier (used internally by Vega)

market_id.description: Market identifier for the account, if [`AccountType`](#vega.AccountType).`ACCOUNT_TYPE_GENERAL` this will be empty

owner.description: The party that the account belongs to, special values include `network`, which represents the Vega network and is most commonly seen during liquidation of distressed trading positions

type.description: The account type related to this account

datanode.api.v1.AssetByIDRequest.description: Request for an asset given an asset identifier

id.description: Asset identifier, required field

datanode.api.v1.AssetByIDResponse.description: Response for an asset given an asset identifier

details.description: The definition of the external source for this asset

decimals.description: Number of decimal / precision handled by this asset

name.description: Name of the asset (e.g: Great British Pound)

quantum.description: The minimum economically meaningful amount in the asset

max_faucet_amount_mint.description: Maximum amount that can be requested by a party through the built-in asset faucet at a time

contract_address.description: The address of the contract for the token, on the ethereum network

total_supply.description: Total circulating supply for the asset

id.description: Internal identifier of the asset

datanode.api.v1.AssetsRequest.description: Request for a list of all assets enabled on Vega

datanode.api.v1.AssetsResponse.description: Response for a list of all assets enabled on Vega

assets.description: A list of 0 or more assets

items.description: The Vega representation of an external asset

details.description: The definition of the external source for this asset

decimals.description: Number of decimal / precision handled by this asset

name.description: Name of the asset (e.g: Great British Pound)

quantum.description: The minimum economically meaningful amount in the asset

max_faucet_amount_mint.description: Maximum amount that can be requested by a party through the built-in asset faucet at a time

contract_address.description: The address of the contract for the token, on the ethereum network

total_supply.description: Total circulating supply for the asset

id.description: Internal identifier of the asset

datanode.api.v1.CandlesRequest.description: Request for a list of candles for a market at an interval

interval.description: Time interval for the candles, required field

since_timestamp.description: Timestamp to retrieve candles since, in nanoseconds since the epoch, required field - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

datanode.api.v1.CandlesResponse.description: Response for a list of candles for a market at an interval

candles.description: A list of 0 or more candles

items.description: Represents the high, low, open, and closing prices for an interval of trading, referred to commonly as a candlestick or candle

datetime.description: An ISO-8601 datetime with nanosecond precision for when the candle was last updated

high.description: Highest price for trading during the candle interval

interval.description: Time interval for the candle - See [`Interval`](#vega.Interval)

low.description: Lowest price for trading during the candle interval

timestamp.description: Timestamp for the point in time when the candle was initially created/opened, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

volume.description: Total trading volume during the candle interval

datanode.api.v1.CandlesSubscribeRequest.description: Request to subscribe to a stream of (Candles)[#vega.Candle]

interval.description: Time interval for the candles, required field.

datetime.description: An ISO-8601 datetime with nanosecond precision for when the candle was last updated

high.description: Highest price for trading during the candle interval

interval.description: Time interval for the candle - See [`Interval`](#vega.Interval)

low.description: Lowest price for trading during the candle interval

timestamp.description: Timestamp for the point in time when the candle was initially created/opened, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

volume.description: Total trading volume during the candle interval

datanode.api.v1.Checkpoint.description: The actual data regarding a checkpoint

datanode.api.v1.CheckpointsRequest.description: Request to get all checkpoints. Currently no fields, probably will be expanded to allow filtering data

datanode.api.v1.CheckpointsResponse.description: Response message containing all checkpoints requested

items.description: The actual data regarding a checkpoint

datanode.api.v1.DelegationsRequest.description: both fields optional but 1 of them required at least party = all delegation for a party node_id = all delegation for a node party_id + node_id = all delegation for a node for a given party

descending.description: Descending reverses the order of the records returned, default is true, if false the results will be returned in ascending order

limit.description: Limit the number of returned records to the value specified, default is 50

skip.description: Skip the number of records specified, default is 0

datanode.api.v1.DepositRequest.description: A request to get a specific deposit by identifier

id.description: The identifier of the deposit

deposit.description: The deposit matching the identifier from the request

asset.description: The Vega asset targeted by this deposit

created_timestamp.description: Timestamp for when the deposit was created on the Vega network

credited_timestamp.description: Timestamp for when the Vega account was updated with the deposit

id.description: Unique identifier for the deposit

party_id.description: Party identifier of the user initiating the deposit

status.description: Status of the deposit

tx_hash.description: The hash of the transaction from the foreign chain

datanode.api.v1.DepositsRequest.description: A request to get a list of deposit from a given party

party_id.description: The party to get the deposits for

datanode.api.v1.DepositsResponse.description: The response for a list of deposits

deposits.description: The list of deposits for the specified party

items.description: A deposit on to the Vega network

asset.description: The Vega asset targeted by this deposit

credited_timestamp.description: Timestamp for when the Vega account was updated with the deposit

party_id.description: Party identifier of the user initiating the deposit

status.description: Status of the deposit

datanode.api.v1.ERC20WithdrawalApprovalR.description: The request to get all information required to bundle the call to finalise the withdrawal on the erc20 bridge

The response with all information required to bundle the call to finalise the withdrawal on the erc20 bridge function withdraw_asset(address asset_source, uint256 asset_id, uint256 amount, uint256 expiry, uint256 nonce, bytes memory signatures)

asset_source.description: The address of asset on ethereum

expiry.description: The expiry / until what time the request is valid

nonce.description: The nonce, which is actually the internal reference for the withdrawal

signatures.description: The signatures bundle as hex encoded data, forward by 0x e.g: 0x + sig1 + sig2 + ... + sixN

target_address.description: The ethereum address to withdraw the funds to, 0x prefixed

datanode.api.v1.EstimateFeeRequest.description: Request to fetch the estimated fee if an order were to trade immediately

order.description: Order to estimate fees for the following fields in the order are required: MarketID (used to specify the fee factors) Price (the price at which the order could trade) Size (the size at which the order could eventually trade)

batch_id.description: Batch identifier for the order, used internally for orders submitted during auctions to keep track of the auction batch this order falls under (required for fees calculation)

created_at.description: Timestamp for when the order was created at, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

expires_at.description: Timestamp for when the order will expire, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`, valid only for [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce)`.TIME_IN_FORCE_GTT`

id.description: Unique identifier for the order (set by the system after consensus)

liquidity_provision_id.description: Is this order created as part of a liquidity provision, will be empty if not.

pegged_order.description: Pegged order details, used only if the order represents a pegged order.

offset.description: Offset from the price reference

reference.description: Which price point are we linked to

price.description: Price for the order, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

reason.description: If the Order `status` is `STATUS_REJECTED` then an [`OrderError`](#vega.OrderError) reason will be specified - The default for this field is `ORDER_ERROR_NONE` which signifies that there were no errors

reference.description: Reference given for the order, this is typically used to retrieve an order submitted through consensus - Currently set internally by the node to return a unique reference identifier for the order submission

remaining.description: Size remaining, when this reaches 0 then the order is fully filled and status becomes STATUS_FILLED

side.description: Side for the order, e.g. SIDE_BUY or SIDE_SELL - See [`Side`](#vega.Side)

size.description: Size for the order, for example, in a futures market the size equals the number of contracts

status.description: The current status for the order. See [`Order.Status`](#vega.Order.Status) - For detail on `STATUS_REJECTED` please check the [`OrderError`](#vega.OrderError) value given in the `reason` field

time_in_force.description: Time in force indicates how long an order will remain active before it is executed or expires. - See [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce)

type.description: Type for the order - See [`Order.Type`](#vega.Order.Type)

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when the Order was last updated, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

version.description: The version for the order, initial value is version 1 and is incremented after each successful amend

datanode.api.v1.EstimateFeeResponse.description: Response to a EstimateFeeRequest, containing the estimated fees for a given order

fee.description: Summary of the estimated fees for this order if it were to trade now

infrastructure_fee.description: Fee amount paid for maintaining the Vega infrastructure

liquidity_fee.description: Fee amount paid to market makers

maker_fee.description: Fee amount paid to the non-aggressive party of the trade

datanode.api.v1.FeeInfrastructureAccount.description: Request for a list of infrastructure fee accounts

asset.description: Asset identifier, required field - Set to an empty string to return all accounts - Set to an asset ID to return a single infrastructure fee account for a given asset

datanode.api.v1.FeeInfrastructureAccount.description: Response for a list of infrastructure fee accounts

accounts.description: A list of 0 or more infrastructure fee accounts

items.description: Represents an account for an asset on Vega for a particular owner or party

balance.description: Balance of the asset, the balance is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places and importantly balances cannot be negative

id.description: Unique account identifier (used internally by Vega)

market_id.description: Market identifier for the account, if [`AccountType`](#vega.AccountType).`ACCOUNT_TYPE_GENERAL` this will be empty

owner.description: The party that the account belongs to, special values include `network`, which represents the Vega network and is most commonly seen during liquidation of distressed trading positions

type.description: The account type related to this account

id.description: Optional - if id omitted it gets the current epoch

delegations.description: List of all delegations in epoch

seq.description: Sequence is used as epoch identifier

end_time.description: Timestamp of epoch end in nanoseconds, empty if not started - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

expiry_time.description: Timestamp of epoch expiry in nanoseconds - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

first_block.description: Height of first block in the epoch

last_block.description: Height of last block in the epoch, empty if not ended

start_time.description: Timestamp of epoch start in nanoseconds - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

validators.description: Validators that participated in this epoch

offline.description: Total number of offline epochs since node was created

online.description: Total number of online epochs since node was created

total.description: Total number of epochs since node was created

ethereum_adddress.description: Ethereum public key of the node

id.description: The node ID (wallet ID)

info_url.description: URL where I can find out more info on the node

location.description: Country code for the location of the node

max_intended_stake.description: Max amount of (wanted) stake, is this a network param or a node param

name.description: Node name

pending_stake.description: Amount of stake on the next epoch

pub_key.description: Pub key of the node operator

staked_by_delegates.description: The amount of stake that has been delegated by token holders

staked_by_operator.description: The amount the node has put up themselves

status.description: Node status

datanode.api.v1.ObserveEventBusRequest.description: Request to subscribe to a stream of one or more event types from the Vega event bus

batch_size.description: Batch size, optional field - If not specified, any events received will be sent immediately. If the client is not ready for the next data-set, data may be dropped a number of times, and eventually the stream is closed. if specified, the first batch will be sent when ready. To receive the next set of events, the client must write an `ObserveEventBatch` message on the stream to flush the buffer. If no message is received in 5 seconds, the stream is closed. Default: 0, send any and all events when they are available.

type.description: One or more types of event, required field

items.description: An (event) bus event type is used to specify a type of event It has 2 styles of event: Single values (e.g. BUS_EVENT_TYPE_ORDER) where they represent one data item Group values (e.g. BUS_EVENT_TYPE_AUCTION) where they represent a group of data items

datanode.api.v1.OrderByIDRequest.description: Request for an order with the specified order identifier Optionally, return a specific version of the order with the `version` field

version.description: Version of the order: - Set `version` to 0 for most recent version of the order - Set `1` for original version of the order - Set `2` for first amendment, `3` for second amendment, etc

batch_id.description: Batch identifier for the order, used internally for orders submitted during auctions to keep track of the auction batch this order falls under (required for fees calculation)

created_at.description: Timestamp for when the order was created at, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

expires_at.description: Timestamp for when the order will expire, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`, valid only for [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce)`.TIME_IN_FORCE_GTT`

id.description: Unique identifier for the order (set by the system after consensus)

liquidity_provision_id.description: Is this order created as part of a liquidity provision, will be empty if not.

pegged_order.description: Pegged order details, used only if the order represents a pegged order.

offset.description: Offset from the price reference

reference.description: Which price point are we linked to

price.description: Price for the order, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

reason.description: If the Order `status` is `STATUS_REJECTED` then an [`OrderError`](#vega.OrderError) reason will be specified - The default for this field is `ORDER_ERROR_NONE` which signifies that there were no errors

reference.description: Reference given for the order, this is typically used to retrieve an order submitted through consensus - Currently set internally by the node to return a unique reference identifier for the order submission

remaining.description: Size remaining, when this reaches 0 then the order is fully filled and status becomes STATUS_FILLED

side.description: Side for the order, e.g. SIDE_BUY or SIDE_SELL - See [`Side`](#vega.Side)

size.description: Size for the order, for example, in a futures market the size equals the number of contracts

status.description: The current status for the order. See [`Order.Status`](#vega.Order.Status) - For detail on `STATUS_REJECTED` please check the [`OrderError`](#vega.OrderError) value given in the `reason` field

time_in_force.description: Time in force indicates how long an order will remain active before it is executed or expires. - See [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce)

type.description: Type for the order - See [`Order.Type`](#vega.Order.Type)

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when the Order was last updated, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

version.description: The version for the order, initial value is version 1 and is incremented after each successful amend

reason.description: If the Order `status` is `STATUS_REJECTED` then an [`OrderError`](#vega.OrderError) reason will be specified - The default for this field is `ORDER_ERROR_NONE` which signifies that there were no errors

reference.description: Reference given for the order, this is typically used to retrieve an order submitted through consensus - Currently set internally by the node to return a unique reference identifier for the order submission

remaining.description: Size remaining, when this reaches 0 then the order is fully filled and status becomes STATUS_FILLED

side.description: Side for the order, e.g. SIDE_BUY or SIDE_SELL - See [`Side`](#vega.Side)

size.description: Size for the order, for example, in a futures market the size equals the number of contracts

status.description: The current status for the order. See [`Order.Status`](#vega.Order.Status) - For detail on `STATUS_REJECTED` please check the [`OrderError`](#vega.OrderError) value given in the `reason` field

time_in_force.description: Time in force indicates how long an order will remain active before it is executed or expires. - See [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce)

type.description: Type for the order - See [`Order.Type`](#vega.Order.Type)

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when the Order was last updated, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

version.description: The version for the order, initial value is version 1 and is incremented after each successful amend

type.description: Account type, required field

datanode.api.v1.PartyAccountsResponse.description: Response for a list of accounts for a party

accounts.description: A list of 0 or more accounts

items.description: Represents an account for an asset on Vega for a particular owner or party

balance.description: Balance of the asset, the balance is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places and importantly balances cannot be negative

datanode.api.v1.PartyByIDRequest.description: Request for a party given a party identifier

datanode.api.v1.PartyByIDResponse.description: Response for a party given a party identifier

id.description: A unique identifier for the party, typically represented by a public key

items.description: StakeLinking - an event notifying of stake being deposited or removed for a given party These events are emitted for every Staking deposit or removed accepted by the network

amount.description: The amount of stake deposited or removed

finalized_at.description: The time at which the vega network finalized the state of the event

id.description: The internal ID for this staking event

party.description: The party to whom the event is directed at.

status.description: The status of the event

datanode.api.v1.PositionsByPartyRequest.description: Request for a list of positions for a party Optionally, if a market identifier is set, the results will be filtered for that market only

positions.description: A list of 0 or more positions

items.description: Represents position data for a party on the specified market on Vega

average_entry_price.description: Average entry price for the position, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

open_volume.description: Open volume for the position, value is signed +ve for long and -ve for short

realised_pnl.description: Realised profit and loss for the position, value is signed +ve for long and -ve for short

unrealised_pnl.description: Unrealised profit and loss for the position, value is signed +ve for long and -ve for short

updated_at.description: Timestamp for the latest time the position was updated

maker_fee.description: Fee amount paid to the non-aggressive party of the trade

seller.description: Unique party identifier for the seller

seller_fee.description: Fee amount charged to the seller party for the trade

liquidity_fee.description: Fee amount paid to market makers

maker_fee.description: Fee amount paid to the non-aggressive party of the trade

timestamp.description: Timestamp for when the trade occurred, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

type.description: Type for the trade - See [`Trade.Type`](#vega.Trade.Type)
